title: Ravinder Travels — frontend readiness for successful publish/deploy

requirements.summary: Harden the frontend build/runtime path so the deployed site reliably serves the latest Marketing page, booking form submission works against the deployed backend, and admin navigation remains accessible after login.
acceptanceCriteria: Deployment completes successfully with no build/deploy errors.
The deployed frontend loads in a browser and renders the Marketing page without runtime errors.
Submitting the "Book a Ride / Request a Quote" form succeeds against the deployed backend (request is accepted and success feedback is shown).
Admin view remains accessible (via the existing UI navigation) and can load booking requests when authenticated as an admin.

file_operations.description: Make actor initialization more deployment-safe by guarding and error-handling the access-control initialization call (e.g., tolerate missing/changed initialization function and avoid blocking app load). This supports the selected authorization component’s authentication/role-based access patterns; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small helper to generate correct static asset URLs using the app’s configured base path so generated images load correctly after deployment (including non-root hosting).

Switch generated hero image reference to use the shared asset URL helper so the deployed Marketing page renders without missing assets/runtime issues. Wire in the existing generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/ravinder-travels-hero.dim_1600x600.png.

Switch generated logo image reference to use the shared asset URL helper so the deployed header renders consistently. Wire in the existing generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/ravinder-travels-logo-rt-red.dim_512x512.png.

Document the exact frontend publish verification steps for this app: production build steps, post-deploy smoke checks (Marketing renders, booking form success feedback, admin navigation + login + requests load). Keep it aligned with REQ-11 acceptance criteria and avoid adding new product features.
